titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Walter Clark papers, 1895-1903
titlestmt.author: Processed by: Rubenstein Staff; EAD finding aid derived from MARC record using marc2ead_sectionA.xsl

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid derived from MARC record via marc2ead_sectionA.xsl, September 2018

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University

did.abstract: Collection contains three articles prepared for the University Magazine of the University of North Carolina entitled "Counties in North Carolina that have Disappeared," "North Carolina in War," and "North Carolina Troops in South America," which concerns the Cartagena expedition to Venezuela, 1740. There is also a letter to Funk and Wagnalls Co. concerning a book they had published.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

prefercite.p: Walter Clark Papers, 1895-1903, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

processinfo.p: This finding aid was derived from a MARC record using a crosswalk defined in marc2ead_sectionA.xsl. The finding aid was generated as part of a larger project to digitize several thousand small collections housed in Section A, September 2018.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: Collection contains three articles prepared for the University Magazine of the University of North Carolina entitled "Counties in North Carolina that have Disappeared," "North Carolina in War," and "North Carolina Troops in South America," which concerns the Cartagena expedition to Venezuela, 1740. There is also a letter to Funk and Wagnalls Co. concerning a book they had published.

controlaccess.subject: Publishers and publishing
controlaccess.corpname: University of North Carolina (1793-1962). University Magazine
